entry.title: ðŸŸ£ Multi-tenancy support within SAP Build Work Zone
entry.content:
Weâ€™re excited to introduce the new Local Entry Point (LEP) concept in SAP Build Work Zone, a game-changer for simplifying how providers integrate business solutions into SAP BTP. It allows providers to automatically generate a standalone entry-point site upon subscription, without requiring a Work Zone instance on consumer tenants. This streamlined approach reduces complexity, accelerates adoption, and makes it easier to deliver seamless multi-tenant business solutions. In this session, weâ€™ll explore how LEP works, the value it brings to providers, and how you can leverage it.

entry.title: Duplicates in draft on test tenant - public cloud
entry.content:
Hi community,

I have created a managed with draft application in the public cloud. ( list report )
I tested it on the dev tenant and then transported it to the test tenant.
The testing on the dev tenant were without errors.
On the test tenant I'm encoutering the following error:
All items that i create, get the same draft uuid. Meaning once i press go I see no data as I get a duplicate error message or if I continue with the create message, i get an page error as again, my table contains duplicates.

Duplicate error:
Failed to get contexts for /sap/opu/odata4/sap/z_billing/srvd/sap/z_billing/0001/Billinginfo with start index 0 and length 30 - Error: Duplicate key predicate: (ParentId=fa163e0b-7372-1fe0-a0fd-9f1480095443,IsActiveEntity=false)

If I look into my odata response with the dev tools, I can see all my created items, still in draft mode, with a non unique draft uuid.

I'm thinking about trying out late numbering to fix the issue, but I don't understand why the issue happens in the first place.
It works fine on the dev system.

a)Any suggestions ?

Further cloud questions related to this issue.
b)How can i delete data from my draft table from the test tenant ?
  Do i need to call an api service that can delete data or build a data managing app ?
c)If I'm not mistaken, it is not possible to look into the databases on the test tenant, correct ?

Kind regards
JT

entry.title: Re: Crystal Reports runtimes get corrupted
entry.content:
That error always means your project is loading different versions of the runtime due to multiple versions installed.

Also, SP 36 has issues, highly recommend updating to SP 38 from here:

https://help.sap.com/docs/SUPPORT_CONTENT/crystalreports/3354091173.html?locale=en-US

And see my blog on upgrading, lots of info to pay attention to in it:

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/upgrading-a-visual-studio-2008-gt-2022-net-project-with-the-latest-cr-net/ba-p/13469215

Make sure you don't have any CR dll's in your \bin folder, always set the Copy Local to false in Visual Studio for all CR assemblies. That can cause mismatched dll's to get loaded.

entry.title: ðŸŸ£ Use GenAI in Process Automation to Adapt 100s of Templates to Your Needs
entry.content:
This live demo showcases how you can use the Generative AI features of SAP Build Process Automation to adapt in a matter of minutes the 100s of pre-built content in the SAP Build Store to fit your complex requirements. You save time by starting with one of the many pre-built content projects, and then again you speed development by adapting it with GenAI.
 
For example, you can take the traditional pre-built Purchase Requisition (PR) approval process, and then with a few prompts add custom decisions, new levels of approval and other Process Automation artifacts to your project. The repository of prebuilt content, along with the GenAI-based adaptations, can greatly accelerate process building.
 
Speakers:
  • Rashmi Mavinakere
  • Ajay Nayak

 
Rashmi Mavinakere is a Product Manager, he builds SAP Build based pre-built content and helps customers adopt them by providing guidance and support in case of issues. With her knowledge of SAP S/4HANA, she tries to build effective end-to-end business scenarios. She enjoys singing and travelling.
 
Ajay Nayak is a Senior Product Manager. He  helps build accelerator content for SAP Build by coordinating between customer's, partners and internal LoB's to come up with real world use cases that solve business problems or accelerate processes. He also supports customers with adoption and consuming pre-built content. He enjoys scuba diving, long drives and gardening in his free time.

entry.title: Re: UKM000 BP Role Assigned Automatically During /SHCM/BU...
entry.content:
Some of the areas where you can investigate are

1. Check CVI Customizing for Role Assignment
Even if BAdIs arenâ€™t active, CVI (Customer/Vendor Integration) settings may include default role assignment logic. Look into SPRO â†’ Cross-Application Components â†’ Master Data Synchronization â†’ Customer/Vendor Integration â†’ Business Partner Settings â†’ Settings for Vendor Integration â†’ Assign BP Role to Vendor Role. Sometimes, UKM000 gets assigned if the BP is flagged as a customer or vendor in the background â€” even if itâ€™s an employee.

2. Review Synchronization Program Logic
The program /SHCM/BUPA_SYNC_S may internally call routines that assign default roles based on BP category or usage. You can use debugging to trace the role assignment step. Look for internal calls to BUPA_ROLE_ADD_2 or similar FM and check if UKM000 is being added based on BP grouping or role mapping.

3. Check BP Grouping and Role Mapping
If your employee BP grouping is mapped to a role category that includes UKM000, it may be assigned automatically. Review BP Grouping â†’ Role Category Mapping. Role Category â†’ Role Assignment Defaults

entry.title: Re: HANA Partitioning - 2 billion rows limitation - Part I: BWoH / BW/4HANA
entry.content:
Hi Colm,

as written in the blog it was extracted from PDF which is located inside TABLE_PLACEMENT.zip of note 2334091. Now with the BW4HANA version it was slightly changed :

BWoH:

InfoObject tables (sap.bw.iobj) are not partitioned, except for InfoObjects with high cardinality and inbound and change log

tables of InfoObjects with enhanced master data update. Those tables are hash partitioned at the first level. All other

InfoObject tables are not partitioned. First level hash partitioned tables of InfoObjects have 1 hash partition regardless of

the number of records in the tables - except for tables with more than 1.5 billion records, see remarks below. InfoObject

tables are located on the coordinator node.

 

BW4HANA

InfoObject tables (sap.bw.iobj) are not partitioned, except for InfoObjects with high cardinality and inbound and change log

tables of InfoObjects with enhanced master data update. Those tables are hash partitioned at the first level. All other

InfoObject tables are not partitioned. First level hash partitioned tables of InfoObjects have 1 hash partition regardless of

the number of records in the tables - except for tables with more than 1.5 billion records, see remarks below. InfoObject

tables are located on worker nodes. All partitions of all tables in a table group are on the same node (slave#1).

 

Regards,

Jens

entry.title: Re: what is the difference between material master pricin...
entry.content:
Basically:

  • The Material Master Price is how SAP values the material in your books (inventory + COGS).
  • Pricing conditions determine how much you pay your vendor or charge your customer for transactions.

If this answer seems incomplete, could you please elaborate on your question?

entry.title: Filter for last event of any case with Signavio Process Intelligence
entry.content:
Hi all,

I would like to create a Filter in SAP Signavio Process Intelligence to: Only show the last event for any case.

Notes on my understanding:

  • I can select the timestamp of the last event for any case with: (SELECT LAST("end_time"))
  • To filter specific events, I have to use an event-based filter

Best,

Benedict

SAP Signavio SAP Signavio Process Intelligence

entry.title: Re: S/4HANA Public Cloud 2502: Custom tile for Custom UI5...
entry.content:
Hello @urielalejo 

In S/4HANA Public Cloud, you cannot copy or modify SAP-delivered tiles such as F2217 â€“ Display Line Item Entry.

The URL parameters P_FromPostingDate and P_ToPostingDate are not included in the appâ€™s inbound navigation signature, so the system disregards them.

Options:

  • For custom UI5 applications, define your own tile and target mapping by using Maintain Launchpad App Descriptor Items, and include any necessary parameters.
  • For external apps, you can use Custom Tiles, but this wonâ€™t allow you to extend SAP standard apps.
  • For F2217, the recommended approach is to use the filter bar, set the Posting Date range, and then select Save as Tile to save those values.

You can check below SAP Documentations references

SAP Help â€“ Maintain Launchpad App Descriptor Items

SAP Help â€“ Custom Tiles

SAP Help â€“ Save/Manage Views and Save as Tile

With kind regards

Chuma

entry.title: SAP UX Q3/2025 Update â€“ Part 7: UI Design and Technology for Web and Mobile
entry.content:
This seventh and last post in my series gives an overview innovations in our UI tools and technologies, making it ever easier to design, build and integrate UIs, for both web and mobile applications. For designing apps, web and mobile, we have a new SAP Design System portal and UI Kits in Figma. For developers, we have added further AI assistance, as well as many individual improvements, including support for the latest international accessibility standard WCAG 2.2. Fun fact: SAPUI5 is now used on all 7 continents â€“ yes, Antarctica too! 

Before reading this, do read the first blog post introducing the series and providing general information about Joule and central entry points and services, along with links to all the published parts of this blog post series:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update â€“ Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

The above post also gives an update on building your own Joule agents, so I will not cover that here, but rather focus on web and mobile UI development.

 

Design News

SAP Design System Portal and UI Kits in Figma

We recently introduced the new SAP Design System portal that brings together the product design guidelines SAP Fiori for web, SAP Fiori for iOS, and SAP Fiori for Android, as well as to the new digital design system guidelines. With its enhanced usability, simplified versioning and improved performance, designers (and developers!) get a better user experience compared with the previous SAP Fiori design guidelines.

Figure 1: The SAP Design System portal start page. Alt Text: Image with header saying â€œSAP Design Systemâ€, with a â€œSee whatâ€™s newâ€ button below it, and then four subsections in a horizontal row: SAP Fiori for Web, SAP Fiori for Android, SAP Fiori for iOS and SAPâ€™s Digitial Design System. A â€œFeedbackâ€ button is on the bottom right.

The new UI Kits available for designers in Figma make it easy for designers to design accessible UIs at enterprise scale, for web applications, mobile iOS and Android applications as well as wearables. The UI Kits provide reusable components for web and mobile, along with web floorplans, which give you what you need out-of-the-box.

Figure 2: SAPâ€™s UI Kits for Designers in Figma. Alt-Text: The image shows two rows of four cards representing UI Kits: SAP Fiori for Android, SAP Fiori for Web, Designing for Performance, SAP Fiori for iOS, SAP Fiori for watchOS, SAP Fiori for Wear OS, SAP S/4HANA for Web, and Accessibility Design Tools. On the very left of the image information about SAP is listed, with links to resources such as www.sap.com/design-system.

Find out more here:

  • New SAP Design System Portal for SAP Fiori Design Guidelines, and New UI Kits for Designers.

Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite

Consistency of the user experience across the various applications used by a user is an important part of overall usability, helping users to feel confident and at ease when using a suite of products â€“ no unexpected surprises. We have identified areas directly relevant to users and plan to introduce a number of design updates in SAP Fiori for web across our suite of products to further increase consistency.

The areas we have redesigned and which we plan to provide across our suite of products this year and next year are:

  • Shell bar (at the top of the userâ€™s screen)
  • Navigation menu: side navigation (see Figure 3 below).
  • User menu
  • Notifications
  • Search in the shell bar

SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition already supports the first four of these, you can have a look at them in part 2 of this series, in the section SAP Fiori Launchpad and Design Updates for Suite Consistency:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update â€“ Part 2: SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition 2508 and SAP Fiori Launchpad.

As outlined in Part 1, SAP Build Work Zone standard edition also supports side navigation.

Find out more about these design updates here:

  • Upcoming Design Updates for the SAP Business Suite (SAP Fiori for Web).

We also provide designers with a refreshed new set of illustrations, to be used for illustrated messages. Figure 3 shows some examples.

Figure 3: Examples of new illustrations. Alt Text: On the left top three different size illustrations showing an ice cream cone fallen on the ground; bottom left an illustration of a globe with a magnifying glass, representing â€œsearchâ€. On the right an image of a list report showing the search illustration since no data has been selected.

 

News for Creating Web UIs

Extensibility made easy with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard

Extending SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition is made much easier since we introduced the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard. The latest update introduces the ability to create an SAPUI5 adaptation project as a User Interface Extension.

Figure 4: Creating an SAPUI5 adaptation project as a User Interface Extension. Alt Text: Screenshot showing step 1 â€œExtensionâ€ task where users can select from a row of four cards â€œCustom Fieldâ€, â€œCustom Logicâ€, â€œCustom Processâ€ and â€œUser Interface Extensionâ€. The latter has a subtext â€œAdapt the current application or extend it visually with a new applicationâ€. The latter two cards have a link â€œManage SAP Build Projectsâ€ at the bottom. The bottom right shows two buttons â€œNextâ€ and â€œCancelâ€.

Learn more here:

  • SAP Build Extensibility Wizard for SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition.
  • Simplify SAPUI5 Code Extensions with the SAP Build Extensibility Wizard

AI-assisted auto-fix of coding errors with UI5 linter

UI5 linter is the tool of choice to check your UI5 project for using best practices and replacement of deprecated SAPUI5 APIs. With UI5 linter v1.12.0, we are happy to announce the initial version of an autofix feature: Use the "--fix" argument to let UI5 linter apply fixes to your code automatically. Read more about it here:

  • Migrate your code with UI5 linter â€“ Autofix has landed.

Legacy-free version of SAPUI5 available via cloud access

Once you have removed code which uses deprecated SAPUI5 APIs, you can try out the legacy-free version of SAP UI5 in the cloud, which has all deprecated code removed. Discover the benefits and how to try it out in this blog post:

  • Explore SAPUI5/OpenUI5 1.136.x-legacy-free.

Accessibility taken to the next level: WCAG 2.2 support

Accessibility is key to using SAP's business solutions. Adopting the latest standards gives applications a true cutting edge, ensuring that solutions are inclusive and meet the diverse needs of users globally. When creating apps with SAP Build and SAPUI5, developers can leverage the latest Web Content Accessibility Guidelines (WCAG) 2.2.

For example, two of the key new requirements in the 2.2 version are:

  • The minimum target size of an interactive element now needs to be 24x24 px, so that users donâ€™t accidentally activate a neighbouring element.
  • Each operation that can be performed by dragging can also be performed alternatively without dragging â€“ so that people who cannot use a mouse to drag can still use the UI.

See more details:

  • SAPUI5 is Leading the Way in Accessibility with WCAG 2.2

SAP Fiori tools â€“ open source, faster app creation, more AI

One of the most powerful recent innovations is the AI-powered project accelerator from SAP Fiori tools, which allows you to create a fully functional app with database tables, CDS-Views, OData service and a Fiori element list report UI based on a sketch of what you want. I introduced this in my Q1 update post from March. This can now be started from Joule in SAP Build Code. Also, it has been further enhanced, and is also available as open source, so that our developer community can make contributions themselves. Find out more here:

  • From idea to app: using AI-powered Project Accelerator to develop SAP Fiori apps
  • SAP Fiori Application Generator Available in Open Source

For those of you developing in ABAP, we have introduced the new quick SAP Fiori application generator to create and deploy simple SAP Fiori applications from ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse. Have a closer look:

  • Quickly Generate and Deploy SAP Fiori Apps from ABAP Development Tools for Eclipse

To get an overview of these plus some additional enhancements, have a look at:

  • SAP Fiori tools 2506 update â€“ Open source, faster app creation, adaptation boost, AI enhancements.

Enhancements for SAP Fiori Elements with OData V4

We are continuously enhancing SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements. I have picked two enhancements to highlight here for developers using SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements on OData V4, which are covered in the following subsections:

  • Support for inline edit for object pages.
  • Support for the analytical table on the object page.

Support for inline edit for object pages

You can now develop object pages where users can directly edit fields within facets, without having to first press the â€œEditâ€ button and go into edit mode. Figure 5 shows an example from a test application.

Figure 5: Inline editing of fields in an object page with SAP Fiori elements for OData V4. Alt Text: A screenshot of part of an object page â€œTravelâ€, which is overall in display mode, but the field â€œStarting Dateâ€ has been selected and is editable, with a new entry made, and â€œSaveâ€ and â€œCancelâ€ icons next to the field.

Support for the analytical table on the object page

For applications where users need to be able to analyze the data in a table, for example grouping data and aggregating data, developers should use the analytical table rather than the responsive table.

These tables are often used for the â€œlistâ€ part of an SAP Fiori elements list report, which consists of a list and an object page for the details. Now, developers using SAPUI5 and SAP Fiori elements on OData V4 can include an analytical table into one of the facets of an object page. Figure 6 shows an example.

Figure 6: Analytical table in an object page with SAP Fiori elements for OData V4. Alt Text: A screenshot of an object page with a facet â€œJournal Entries (4)â€ which contains an analytical table, where the entries are grouped by â€œCase Journal Entryâ€. One of the groups is expanded, showing two lines. Below them the sum of the debit column is shown for the expanded group, and below that for the entire table.

Further Updates for SAPUI5

As I described in part 1 of this series, we have introduced a new option to preview an upcoming SAPUI5 version for SAP Build Work Zone. This capability aims to provide a controlled environment for evaluating SAPUI5 updates in SAP Build Work Zone, thereby avoiding immediate changes in production environments:

  • Introducing SAPUI5 Version Preview in SAP Build Work Zone.

Key users can create consistent text changes with SAPUI5 flexibility. I described this in the context of SAP S/4HANA Cloud Public Edition in part 2 of this series (section Key Users Can Rearrange ID and Description Within a Field or Column). They can also easily change the labels used, to fit terms established within the company. Read more about this here:

  • How Key Users Create Consistent Text Changes with SAPUI5 Flexibility.

SAPUI5 has reached a new milestone: it is now used on all 7 continents. Yes, we have reached Antarctica!

  • SAPUI5 adoption becoming more universal.

In case you have not updated your system for a while, then be aware that we are removing SAP Fiori themes Belize and Blue Crystal. Also, make sure that you are using the latest browser versions, which may mean ensuring that your users laptops and desktops are using newer operating system versions:

  • Upcoming Removal of SAP Fiori Themes Belize and Blue Crystal
  • Prevent an SAP Fiori / SAPUI5 Downtime â€” Check Your Browser Strategy Today!

To get a complete overview of all the enhancements in SAPUI5 including SAP Fiori elements, look at the UI5 demo kit. Youâ€™ll find some of the enhancements mentioned above listed under version 1.136.

  • Whatâ€™s New in SAP UI5.

 

News for Mobile Designers and Developers

The main news for mobile designers are the new SAP Design System portal, which covers Android and iOS as well as the latest releases of the mobile Figma design kits for Android, iOS, WatchOs and WearOS.

Figure 7: The Android and iOS pages in the new SAP Design System portal. Alt Text: Both screenshots look the same, except for Android vs iOS text. The top has a â€œGet Startedâ€ section, with a row of cards to navigate to UI Elements, UI Kit, Development Documentation. Below that a â€œWhatâ€™s Newâ€ section, with information about the latest release â€œSAP Fiori for Android version 25.8â€ and â€œâ€¦for iOSâ€¦â€.

The best place to stay up-to-date with these latest enhancements is the respective Whatâ€™s New section in the SAP Design System portal:

  • SAP BTP SDK for iOS 25.4: Whatâ€™s new for SAP Fiori for iOS
  • SAP BTP SDK for Android 25.8 (design preview) and 25.4: Whatâ€™s new for SAP Fiori for Android

Figure 8 shows two of the many new enhancements: the new illustrations mentioned earlier in the section on web UIs are also available for mobile, both for iOS and Android. The other example shown there is the updated date picker for Android, which now allows users to select date ranges.

Figure 8: On the left, an example of the new illustrated messages for mobile. On the right, date ranges can now be selected in the date picker for Android. Alt Text: The illustrated message is used in a pop-over. The illustration shows a sheet of paper with a tickmark, below that the text â€œYouâ€™re all caught upâ€¦â€ and two buttons â€œAdd Taskâ€ and â€œRemind Me Laterâ€. On the right two date screens are shown for the month of April: the left one has the 8th marked, the right one has the range from 8th to 16th marked.

Developers get new features with the latest releases of the mobile SDKs, as well as the the Mobile Development Kit (MDK) which is integrated into SAP Build Code. Here are links to find out more about them:

  • Whatâ€™s new in Mobile development kit client 25.6, for example:
    • Support grouping in Object Table Control
    • Donut chart support
    • â€¦ and more.
  • Continuous Innovation in Mobile Design & Technology: SAP Fiori for Android and iOS 25.4
  • SAP BTP SDK for iOS: Whatâ€™s New in 25.08
  • SAP BTP SDK for Android 25.4.0 is now available

 

Final words

As you can see from all seven posts in the series, we continue to progress rapidly with the user experience of our product portfolio, especially with regards to AI-assistance.

Part 1 of the series lists all the parts, and links to those parts that have already been published:

  • SAP UX Q3/2025 Update â€“ Part 1: AI, Joule, SAP Build Work Zone, SAP Mobile Start.

Do keep posting your experiences and recommendations yourself in the SAP Community, with the SAP Fiori and/or the User Experience tag! In case you are wondering how to get a list of the most recent blog posts on SAP Fiori and User Experience in our new SAP Community, use these links:

  • Latest blog posts on SAP Fiori in the SAP Community.
  • Latest blog posts on User Experience in the SAP Community.

For general information on design at SAP and SAP Fiori, check out:

  • www.sap.com/design.
  • www.sap.com/fiori.

entry.title: Re: The Next Phase in the Deprecation of the Classic Experience in SAP Analytics Cloud
entry.content:
Hi,

We are being asked to migrate hundreds of Classic stories to Optimized yet not given the tools to do this... 

I have spent the last week talking to SAP regarding getting a simple list out if the system of ALL Classic stories and All those that have been Optimised (Unified not OVM) to date.  It would appear this simple ask is not currently possible!?!

Not only are OVM classed as Optimised in the System stats, which to my understanding is incorrect and these OVM are actulally Classic and need to be migrated also? please confirm that?

The system models only go back to April so we cant determine usage  to see what worth converting and models show some content as Null rather than classic or optimised or worse both null and one of these whatever that means. 

Most system models don't show Parent folder so are useless.

We also find bulk migration tool wont work with sub folders! Who doesn't use subfolders? Are we actually expected to go folder by folder?

The Q3 2025 release brought in Classic and Optmised story icons, these are displaying incorrectly and have raised this with SAP.

How is a large company actually expected to migrate huge quatities of content when we cant even get the basic value of classic and optimised stories out of the system in the first place?

The deprecation of classic content is poorly thought out,  tools are not in place to assist, migration is not like for like so requires rebuild, months of Analysts time wasted rebuilding what already exists for no value added.

Deprecation should be scrapped. Classic shoud remain as is and all new content Optimised, simple.

The we can concentrate on value added activites rather than wasting our time.

I look forward to finding out how we can get the info we need out of the system.

Regards

entry.title: Re: SAP CPI suppressing root and row elements in XML to J...
entry.content:
Hello,

You can use the below script to achive this:

 
def Message processData(Message message) {
    def xml = new XmlSlurper().parseText(message.getBody(java.lang.String.class))
    def rows = xml.row.collect { r ->
        [
            private_agency_code: r.private_agency_code.text(),
            branch_code        : r.branch_code.text()
        ]
    }    
    def out = JsonOutput.prettyPrint(JsonOutput.toJson(rows))
    message.setBody(out.toString())
    return message
}

entry.title: Re: EXTERNAL JOIN when using temporary tables
entry.content: Crystal Reports never removes the links; they are always present. Only the generated SQL code is different depending on the table types. If all linked tables are regular tables (or views), an INNER JOIN or OUTER JOIN is generated. As soon as at least one temporary table is involved, the links are mapped with EXTERNAL JOINS, even though the model is exactly the same and all tables are, of course, located in the same database. (My understanding of the documentation is that EXTERNAL JOINS are only used to merge data from different data sources.) I also tried removing the links and setting them again, but the result is the same. Crystal Reports obviously treats temporary tables differently to regular tables, and I would like to understand why.

entry.title: Re: Navigating the Future: Understanding Upcoming Changes to SAP Universal ID
entry.content:
Hi everyone, 

as there were some questions about how to deal in situation where a person is using the same email for several S-users. 

These users can set a password to their convenience. In case the user sets the same password to all users we recommend using the S/P-user Id and related password for login. Same applies to password reset in SAP IDS, the user needs then to use the related S/P-user to request a password reset.
 
SAP Support teams are already informed about this, if there are any questions relatedly to the UID password migration which started recently, they can simply reach out there to get help as well. 
An "account selector" will be available later this year which will allow you to select the appropriate users you are needing for the current login. This will be communicated accordingly once available. 
 
Please get in connection to SAP Support to get technical help, instead of posting things in this blog. 
 
Thanks and best regards.
Customer Identity Management Team

entry.title: Re: SAP CPI suppressing root and row elements in XML to J...
entry.content:
import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import groovy.xml.*
import groovy.json.*

Message processData(Message message) {

  
    def body = message.getBody(java.lang.String) as String
    def xml = new XmlSlurper().parseText(body)
    def list = xml.row.collect { row ->
        [
            private_agency_code: row.private_agency_code.text(),
            branch_code       : row.branch_code.text()
        ]
    }
    def json = JsonOutput.prettyPrint(JsonOutput.toJson(list))
    message.setBody(json)
    return message
}

 

just realized another answer also there

entry.title: Re: How to find the line items that made up settlement? T...
entry.content: Thanks for the information. I was able to determine that SAP applies the rounding difference to the last row in the distribution rule. For example if the total of all records settled is 17464.38 and the distribution percentage is 20% and there are five wbs elements the first four rows get 3,492.88 and the last row gets 3492.86. (17464.38 - (3492.88 * 4)) gives you the last row amount. But when dealing with individual rows (the rows that made up the total settled) you can only apply the distribution percentage and store as 3 decimal places, in the end the sum of all the line items add up to the amount settled across all wbs elements. SAP should have stored everything in 3 decimal places in my opinion.

entry.title: Sales Document BAdI Overview in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud
entry.content:
Sales Document BAdI Overview

In SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, customers' business processes can be fundamentally covered by SAP best practice solutions. To meet various customer business requirements, extensibility is essential. In terms of extensibility, Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) are critical as they allow customers to implement custom logic to influence SAP standard business processes.

In SAP ECC or SAP PCE/OP, there are User-exits and VOFM Routines available that customer could update standard business object in business processings. As these techniques are not supported in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud, Business Add-Ins (BAdIs) become the most prevalent approach to influence SAP standard business processes. 

Up to SAP S/4HANA CE2508, there are following Cloud BAdIs defined in sales order processing. These Cloud BAdIs are called in well defined process sequence. For instance, the BAdI SD_SLS_MODIFY_HEAD is always processed before the BAdI "SD_SLS_CHECK_BEFORE_SAVE". 

 

This blog explains the definition of Cloud BAdIs in sales order processing. I hope this blog can help you better understand sales order BAdIs and enable you to utilize them effectively in your business. 

Benefit of Sales Document BAdIs

The following benefits illustrate how sales document BAdIs can fulfill customer requirements:

  • Sales document Cloud BAdIs provide capabilities that enable customers to implement custom logic to influence the sales order process, regardless of the channel through which the sales order is processed.
  • Sales document Cloud BAdIs ensure that the custom logic is processed within the same LUW (Logic Unit of Work).
  • Since Cloud BAdIs are always triggered automatically, they reduce the complexity for business users and increase efficiency.

Definition of Sales Document BAdIs

Most sales document BAdIs are defined on following business contexts:

  • Sales: Sales Document (Header)
  • Sales: Sales Document Item (Item)

There are other business contexts used in sales BAdIs which work for some special sales business processes, such as:

  • Sales: Listing/Exclusion
  • Sales: Sales Order Request
  • Sales: Sales Scheduling Agreement Delivery Schedule
  • Sales: Text Determination

Since all sales document BAdIs are documented in SAP help, I will not explain them again in this blog. However, I will categorize those BAdIs into the following groups.

Pre-processing BAdIs

There is no official term for "Pre-processing BAdI" in SAP. Here, I would like to refer to all BAdIs that are triggered before the core processing of the sales document as "Pre-processing BAdIs," including the following:

BAdI NameDescriptionBusiness ContextPurpose/Usage
SD_SLS_COPY_RQMT_HEAD_BILCopying Requirements for Sales Documents (from Billing Documents)Sales: Sales DocumentYou can use this BAdI to provide routines for copying requirement from billing document to sales document
SD_SLS_COPY_RQMT_HEAD_SLSCopying Requirements for Sales Documents (from Sales Documents)Sales: Sales DocumentYou can use this BAdI to provide routines for copying requirement from sales document to sales document
SD_SLS_DATA_TRANSFER_HEADData Transfer for Sales Document HeadersSales: Sales DocumentYou can implement this BAdI to influence the data transfer of copy control
EDI_SD_ORDER_MODIFY_HEADERHeader Modification for Sales Orders/Returns Orders in Inbound EDISales: Sales DocumentYou can implement this BAdI to update certain field of the EDI payload message
EDI_SD_ORDER_MODIFY_HEAD_PARTYHeader Partner Modification for Sales Orders/Returns Orders in Inbound EDISales: Sales DocumentYou can implement this BAdI to update certain field of the EDI payload message 
EDI_SD_INB_ORDER_TEXT_HEADMapping of Text Types for Header Texts in EDI Inbound ProcessingSales: Sales DocumentYou can implement this BAdI to map the text types n EDI inbound processing
SD_SLS_COPY_RQMT_ITEM_BILCopying Requirements for Sales Document Items (from Billing Documents)Sales: Sales Document ItemYou can use this BAdI to provide routines for copying requirement from billing document item to sales document item
SD_SLS_COPY_RQMT_ITEM_SLSCopying Requirements for Sales Document Items (from Sales Documents)Sales: Sales Document ItemYou can use this BAdI to provide routines for copying requirement from sales document item to sales document item
SD_SLS_DATA_TRANSFER_ITEMData Transfer for Sales Document ItemsSales: Sales Document ItemYou can implement this BAdI to influence the data transfer of copy control
EDI_SD_ORDER_MODIFY_ITEMItem Modification for Sales Orders/Returns Orders in Inbound EDISales: Sales Document ItemYou can implement this BAdI to update certain field of the EDI payload message
EDI_SD_ORDER_MODIFY_ITEM_PARTYItem Partner Modification for Sales Orders/Returns Orders in Inbound EDISales: Sales Document ItemYou can implement this BAdI to update certain field of the EDI payload message
EDI_SD_INB_ORDER_TEXT_ITEMMapping of Text Types for Item Texts in EDI Inbound ProcessingSales: Sales Document ItemYou can implement this BAdI to map the text types n EDI inbound processing

Transactional BAdIs

The transactional BAdI is processed in transactional manner during business object processing. It can be processed multiple times based on business object operation. For example, the sales order modify BAdI (SD_SLS_MODIFY_HEAD) is triggered as soon as sales order header is processed. 

Most sales document transactional BAdIs can influence sales document processes, for example, you can implement transactional BAdIs to modify sales document custom fields or certain standard fields. 

Since the sales document data is changed frequently by user interaction, the import parameters of the transactional BAdIs may not be stable. The field values set by custom logic could also be overwritten by standard logic or other custom logic due to dependencies. 

Below table lists transactional BAdIs in sales document process. 

BAdI NameDescriptionBusiness ContextPurpose/Usage
SD_SLS_CHECK_HEADCheck of Header Data in Sales DocumentsSales: Sales DocumentYou can implement custom logic to check sales document header data and raise messages
SD_SLS_CHECK_ITEMCheck of Item Data in Sales DocumentsSales: Sales Document ItemYou can implement custom logic to check sales document item and raise messages
SD_SLS_MODIFY_HEADModification of Header Custom Fields in Sales DocumentsSales: Sales DocumentIt is possible to modify custom fields on sales document header level via this BAdI
SD_SLS_MODIFY_ITEMModification of Item Custom Fields in Sales DocumentsSales: Sales Document ItemIt is possible to modify custom fields on sales document item level via this BAdI
SD_SLS_MODIFY_HEAD_BUSINESSModification of Business Data in Sales Document HeadersSales: Sales DocumentIt is possible to modify some standard fields on sales document header level via this BAdI
SD_SLS_MODIFY_ITEM_BUSINESSModification of Business Data in Sales Document ItemsSales: Sales Document ItemIt is possible to modify some standard fields on sales document item level via this BAdI
SD_SLS_MODIFY_HEAD_TAXModification of Tax Data in Sales Document HeadersSales: Sales DocumentIt is possible to modify tax-relevant fields on sales document header level via this BAdI
SD_SLS_MODIFY_ITEM_TAXModification of Tax Data in Sales Document ItemsSales: Sales Document ItemIt is possible to modify tax-relevant fields on sales document item level via this BAdI
SD_SLS_MODIFY_ITEM_REQDATE
Modification of Requested Delivery Date for Sales Document ItemsSales: Sales Document ItemYou can implement this BAdI to modify requested delivery date on item level
SD_SLS_CHECK_DELETE_ITEMCheck of Sales Document Items Before DeletionSales: Sales Document ItemYou can implement this BAdI to disallow deletion of sales document items

Final Phase BAdIs

The final-phase BAdI differs from the transactional BAdI because the final-phase BAdI is processed during the document save. Normally, the final-phase BAdI is called only once during the save process, and the import parameters are relatively more stable.

The user may not see the impact of the final-phase BAdI immediately during their interactions. In many cases, the user only sees the result after the business object is saved. The end user has limited control over the custom logic implemented in the final-phase BAdI.

In customer's end-to-end business, the final-phase BAdIs are quite important to fulfill various business requirements, especially for automated processes like API channel, integration channel, etc. 

Here are most used final-phase BAdIs in sales document process.

BAdI NameDescriptionBusiness ContextPurpose/Usage
SD_SLS_FINALIZEModification of Sales Document in Finalize Phase before Save

Sales: Sales Document 

Sales: Sales Document Item

It is possible to modify custom fields and some standard fields in sales document finalize phase before save
SD_SLS_CHECK_BEFORE_SAVECheck of Sales Documents Before Saving

Sales: Sales Document 

Sales: Sales Document Item

You can implement custom logic to validate sales document and prevent from saving document
SD_APM_SET_APPROVAL_REASONApproval Request Reasons for Sales DocumentsSales: Sales Document You can implement custom logic to control whether a sales document should trigger the workflow approval

Post-processing BAdIs 

Post-processing BAdIs are triggered after the sales document is processed, and normally do not prevent the sales document from being saved. 

Following BAdIs are categorized as post-processing BAdIs in sales document process.

BAdI NameDescriptionBusiness ContextPurpose/Usage
EDI_SD_ORDER_CONF_OUT_HEADERHeader Modification for Sales Orders/Returns Orders in Outbound EDISales: Sales Document You can implement this BAdI to change the sales order EDI outbound message
EDI_SD_ORDER_CONF_OUT_ITEMItem Modification for Sales Orders/Returns Orders in Outbound EDISales: Sales Document You can implement this BAdI to change the sales order EDI outbound message
APOC_ADD_EMAIL_RECIPIENTSBAdI: Addition of Email RecipientsOutput Request Item You can implement this BAdI to add email recipients in sales document output items

Determination BAdIs 

There are some determination BAdIs triggered in sales document processing but not defined in sales document business context, e.g. listing/exclusion determination, text determination, pricing, etc. 

Following Cloud BAdIs are relevant to sales document processing.

BAdI NameDescriptionBusiness ContextPurpose/Usage
SD_LSTG_EXCLSN_RQMT_DOCRequirements in Listing/Exclusion for Sales DocumentsSales: Listing/Exclusion You can implement this BAdI to define requirement for listing/exclusion in sales documents
SD_LSTG_EXCLSN_RQMT_DOC_ITEMRequirements in Listing/Exclusion for Sales Document ItemsSales: Listing/Exclusion :  You can implement this BAdI to define requirement for listing/exclusion in sales document items
SD_TEXTS_COPY_REQUIREMENTCopying Requirement in Text DeterminationSales: Text Determination You can implement this BAdI to define requirement for text determination in SD documents
SD_TEXTS_DATA_TRANSFERData Transfer in Text DeterminationSales: Text Determination You can implement this BAdI to change the source text that transferred in sales documents
PRICING_DOCUMENT_REQUIREMENTDefine Requirement in Pricing for DocumentPricing You can implement this BAdI to control pricing requirement in sales documents
PRCG_DOCUMENT_ITEM_REQUIREMENT
Define Requirement in Pricing for Document ItemPricing You can implement this BAdI to control pricing requirement in sales document items

Things Behind the Scenes 

We often receive questions about sales document BAdIs from customers and partners in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Some of those questions are generic and applicable to many customers and partners, so it makes sense to share the details of those points here. 

Why are User-Exits not available in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud?

Answer: according to clean core extensibility guidance (see SAP note 3578329), user-exits are kind of modification and not supported in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Only the Cloud BAdIs and the released APIs are recommended in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. 

Why are only some fields from the sales document available as import parameters in the BAdI?

Answer: there are following reasons to decide what fields shall be exposed in Cloud BAdI as import parameter:

  • Field mapping is costly in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. We only expose most useful fields into Cloud BAdIs as parameters for performance consideration.
  • Only the Global Field Name (GFN) is allowed to be exposed in SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud. Not all sales document fields have GFN defined. 

Why are many sales document standard fields not modifiable via Cloud BAdI?

Answer: it is always challenging to update sales document standard fields via custom logic because of dependencies. There are many standard logic processes that determine standard fields based on other fields during sales document processing. Inappropriate custom logic to update standard fields could lead to the following issues:

  • The standard field set by custom logic could be overwritten by standard logic 
  • Using Cloud BAdI to update standard fields might jeopardize standard sales document processes
  • Business object data could become inconsistent due to inappropriate custom logic determination

Therefore, only some sales document standard fields are possible to be modified by Cloud BAdIs. The product team is working hard to bring more changeable standard fields into Cloud BAdIs. 

Summary

SAP S/4HANA Public Cloud provides many Cloud BAdIs that allow customers and partners to influence standard sales document processes for various business purposes. A better understanding of Cloud BAdIs can help customers and partners decide how to best utilize them to fulfill business requirements.

I will also introduce some blog posts that explain real use cases for specific sales document Cloud BAdIs. Please stay tuned for updates.

entry.title: Where can start learning how to use the SAP Sustainability Data Exchange?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Setting up SAP Sustainability Data Exchange   learning journey.

Overview
The learners will be able to use SAP Sustainability Data Exchange to collect manage and share the product carbon footprint data with business partners across the supply chain.

Learning objectives
Configure the technical integrations between SAP Sustainability Data Exchange (SDX) and various external systems, including SAP Sustainability Footprint Management (SFM), Catena-X data ecosystem, and SAP Business Network (SBN), to ensure seamless data exchange and accurate sustainability reporting.

Prerequisites

  • Getting Started with SAP Sustainability Data Exchange
 
Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.


I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards
Margit

entry.title: Re: Error-No agents determined after execution of respons...
entry.content:
Hello,

Can you please check whether the following information (GenAI was used to help generate this content) helps you solve the issue?

When setting up a flexible workflow for supplier invoices based on a custom field, it is crucial to ensure that all configurations are correctly aligned. Here are some steps to troubleshoot the error you are facing:

  1. Verify Custom Field Mapping: Ensure that the custom field is correctly mapped in all relevant â€˜Responsibility Managementâ€™ configuration settings. Double-check that the field is correctly assigned in the â€˜Manage Teams and Responsibilitiesâ€™ app.

  2. Check Workflow Activation: Make sure that the flexible workflow is activated 3170025 - Error â€˜An error occurred while activating the workflowâ€™ happens when activating supplier invoice flexible workflow in the â€˜Manage Workflows for Supplier Invoicesâ€™ app. You can do this by navigating to the app and checking the status of the workflow.

  3. Review Approver Assignment: Sourcing and Procurement - Manage Workflows for Supplier Invoices Confirm that approvers are correctly assigned in the â€˜Manage Teams and Responsibilitiesâ€™ app. Ensure that the custom field is used in the responsibility definitions and that the approvers are linked to these definitions.

  4. Error Analysis: If the error persists, use the â€˜Workflow Administrationâ€™ app to analyze the workflow issues. This app can provide insights into any missing configurations or errors in the workflow setup.

Please follow all steps described here: Flexible Workflow for Supplier Invoices

Kind regards, Henrike

entry.title: Re: SAP CPI suppressing root and row elements in XML to J...
entry.content:
use the standard XML to JSON converter then it will have like 

{ "row": [ { "private_agency_code": "0000110033", "branch_code": "2100" }, { "private_agency_code": "0000110035", "branch_code": "2300" } ] }

then remove 

 { "row": }

with the Groovy code 

import com.sap.gateway.ip.core.customdev.util.Message
import groovy.json.*
import groovy.json.*

Message processData(Message message) {

    def body = message.getBody(String)
    def json = new JsonSlurper().parseText(body)
    def list = json.row
    def output = JsonOutput.prettyPrint(JsonOutput.toJson(list))
    message.setBody(output)
    return message
}

per account

per company

"If you raise the implementation status of a company code above the corresponding implementation status of the account to which it is assigned, the account value is also raised. entry.title: (Solved) Use Case: Bulk Clone SAP Domains and Data Elements from CSV
entry.content:
Use Case: Bulk Clone SAP Domains and Data Elements from CSV with Description Retention

This ABAP program automates the cloning of multiple SAP domains and data elements by reading old and new names from a CSV file. It not only creates new objects but also copies their short text descriptions seamlessly using the SAP text management function modules READ_TEXT and SAVE_TEXT. The program supports both domains and data elements, offers file selection with F4 help, and activates newly created objects automatically. This solution significantly speeds up mass cloning tasks in SAP development, ensuring consistency and saving manual effort.

ðŸš€ How to Use the Bulk Clone Tool for Domains & Data Elements

âœ¨ **Prepare Your CSV File** âœ¨
- No headers, just clean comma-separated values (.csv)
- Keep it simple: use **ONE file at a time** for either **Domains** or **Data Elements** (donâ€™t mix!)
- Format example:
* OLD_DOMAIN_NAME_1,NEW_DOMAIN_NAME_1
* OLD_DATAELEMENT_1,NEW_DATAELEMENT_1

ðŸš€ **Run the Program** ðŸš€
- Hit **F4** to open the file browser & pick your CSV
- Check the boxes for **Domains** and/or **Data Elements** to match your file
- Press **Execute** and watch the magic happen!
- Keep an eye on the screen logs for âœ”ï¸ success messages or âš ï¸ warnings

abap program -

REPORT zclone_doma_dtel_from_csv1.

TYPE-POOLS: truxs.
************************************************************************
* SELECTION SCREEN
************************************************************************
PARAMETERS: p_path TYPE rlgrap-filename OBLIGATORY,
            p_doma AS CHECKBOX DEFAULT 'X',
            p_dtel AS CHECKBOX DEFAULT 'X'.

************************************************************************
* TYPES & VARIABLES
************************************************************************
TYPES: BEGIN OF ty_mapping,
         old_name TYPE ddobjname,
         new_name TYPE ddobjname,
       END OF ty_mapping.

DATA: lt_mapping TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF ty_mapping,
      ls_mapping TYPE ty_mapping,
      lt_raw     TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF string,
      lv_line    TYPE string,
      lt_files   TYPE filetable,
      lv_rc      TYPE i,
      lv_file    TYPE string,
      lv_fname   TYPE string,
      lv_name    TYPE thead-tdname.

DATA: ls_doma        TYPE dd01v,
      ls_doma_text   TYPE dd01t,
      ls_dtel        TYPE dd04v,
      ls_dtel_text   TYPE dd04t,
      lt_texts       TYPE STANDARD TABLE OF itctc,
      ls_text        TYPE itctc.

************************************************************************
* F4 HELP FOR FILE PATH
************************************************************************
AT SELECTION-SCREEN ON VALUE-REQUEST FOR p_path.
  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>file_open_dialog
    EXPORTING
      window_title      = 'Select CSV File'
      default_extension = 'csv'
      file_filter       = 'CSV Files (*.csv)|*.csv|All Files (*.*)|*.*'
    CHANGING
      file_table        = lt_files
      rc                = lv_rc
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS            = 1.
  IF sy-subrc = 0 AND lv_rc > 0.
    READ TABLE lt_files INTO lv_file INDEX 1.
    p_path = lv_file.
  ENDIF.

************************************************************************
* START OF SELECTION
************************************************************************
START-OF-SELECTION.

  lv_fname = p_path.

  " Upload CSV
  CALL METHOD cl_gui_frontend_services=>gui_upload
    EXPORTING
      filename = lv_fname
      filetype = 'ASC'
    CHANGING
      data_tab = lt_raw
    EXCEPTIONS
      OTHERS   = 1.
  IF sy-subrc <> 0.
    MESSAGE 'Error uploading file' TYPE 'E'.
  ENDIF.

  " Parse CSV
  LOOP AT lt_raw INTO lv_line.
    SPLIT lv_line AT ',' INTO ls_mapping-old_name ls_mapping-new_name.
    APPEND ls_mapping TO lt_mapping.
  ENDLOOP.

************************************************************************
* COPY DOMAINS
************************************************************************
  IF p_doma = abap_true.

    LOOP AT lt_mapping INTO ls_mapping.

      CLEAR: ls_doma, ls_doma_text, lt_texts, ls_text.

      " Get original domain definition
      CALL FUNCTION 'DDIF_DOMA_GET'
        EXPORTING
          name = ls_mapping-old_name
        IMPORTING
          dd01v_wa = ls_doma
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS = 1.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        WRITE: / 'âŒ Domain not found:', ls_mapping-old_name.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.

      " Change name
      ls_doma-domname = ls_mapping-new_name.

      " Put new domain
      CALL FUNCTION 'DDIF_DOMA_PUT'
        EXPORTING
          name     = ls_mapping-new_name
          dd01v_wa = ls_doma
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS = 1.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        WRITE: / 'âŒ Error creating domain:', ls_mapping-new_name.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.

      " Copy long texts
      CLEAR ls_text.
      ls_text-destobject = 'DD01T'.
      ls_text-destname   = ls_mapping-new_name.
      ls_text-destid     = 'DOMA'.
      ls_text-destlang   = sy-langu.
      ls_text-srcobject  = 'DD01T'.
      ls_text-srcname    = ls_mapping-old_name.
      ls_text-srcid      = 'DOMA'.
      ls_text-srclang    = sy-langu.
      APPEND ls_text TO lt_texts.

      CALL FUNCTION 'COPY_TEXTS'
        EXPORTING
          savemode_direct = 'X'
          insert          = 'X'
        TABLES
          texts           = lt_texts
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS          = 1.

      " Copy short description (DD01T)
      SELECT SINGLE * FROM dd01t INTO ls_doma_text
       WHERE domname = ls_mapping-old_name AND ddlanguage = sy-langu.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        ls_doma_text-domname = ls_mapping-new_name.
        INSERT dd01t FROM ls_doma_text.
      ENDIF.

      " Activate domain
      CALL FUNCTION 'DDIF_DOMA_ACTIVATE'
        EXPORTING
          name = ls_mapping-new_name
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS = 1.

      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        WRITE: / 'âœ… Domain created:', ls_mapping-new_name.
      ELSE.
        WRITE: / 'âš ï¸ Domain activation failed:', ls_mapping-new_name.
      ENDIF.

    ENDLOOP.

  ENDIF.

************************************************************************
* COPY DATA ELEMENTS
************************************************************************
  IF p_dtel = abap_true.

    LOOP AT lt_mapping INTO ls_mapping.

      CLEAR: ls_dtel, ls_dtel_text, lt_texts, ls_text.

      " Get original data element
      CALL FUNCTION 'DDIF_DTEL_GET'
        EXPORTING
          name = ls_mapping-old_name
        IMPORTING
          dd04v_wa = ls_dtel
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS = 1.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        WRITE: / 'âŒ Data element not found:', ls_mapping-old_name.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.

      " Change name
      ls_dtel-rollname = ls_mapping-new_name.

      " Put new data element
      CALL FUNCTION 'DDIF_DTEL_PUT'
        EXPORTING
          name     = ls_mapping-new_name
          dd04v_wa = ls_dtel
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS = 1.
      IF sy-subrc <> 0.
        WRITE: / 'âŒ Error creating data element:', ls_mapping-new_name.
        CONTINUE.
      ENDIF.

      " Copy long text
      CLEAR ls_text.
      ls_text-destobject = 'DD04T'.
      ls_text-destname   = ls_mapping-new_name.
      ls_text-destid     = 'DTEL'.
      ls_text-destlang   = sy-langu.
      ls_text-srcobject  = 'DD04T'.
      ls_text-srcname    = ls_mapping-old_name.
      ls_text-srcid      = 'DTEL'.
      ls_text-srclang    = sy-langu.
      APPEND ls_text TO lt_texts.

      CALL FUNCTION 'COPY_TEXTS'
        EXPORTING
          savemode_direct = 'X'
          insert          = 'X'
        TABLES
          texts           = lt_texts
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS          = 1.

      " Copy short description (DD04T)
      SELECT SINGLE * FROM dd04t INTO ls_dtel_text
       WHERE rollname = ls_mapping-old_name AND ddlanguage = sy-langu.
      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        ls_dtel_text-rollname = ls_mapping-new_name.
        INSERT dd04t FROM ls_dtel_text.
      ENDIF.

      " Activate
      CALL FUNCTION 'DDIF_DTEL_ACTIVATE'
        EXPORTING
          name = ls_mapping-new_name
        EXCEPTIONS
          OTHERS = 1.

      IF sy-subrc = 0.
        WRITE: / 'âœ… Data element created:', ls_mapping-new_name.
      ELSE.
        WRITE: / 'âš ï¸ Data element activation failed:', ls_mapping-new_name.
      ENDIF.

    ENDLOOP.
  ENDIF.

ðŸ’¡ Tips for Creating Large Numbers

âœ… Test with 5â€“10 entries first to ensure structure and naming is correct.

â³ For large uploads, consider running it as a background job (via SM36).

entry.title: Wereh can I start learning to ceate and optimize extended stories and R visualizations?
entry.content:
I recommend to access our Exploring Development Options in SAP Analytics Cloud   learning journey. 

Learning Objectives
By the end of this Learning Journey, you will be able to:
  • Create extended stories using scripting.
  • Create R visualizations in stories.
  • Manage and optimize performance in extended stories.
Learning Journey Goal
  • Get started with SAP: Building the basics
  • Develop your expertise: Skill deepening learning
  • Excel in your expertise: Advanced specialization learning

Prerequisites

  • Start here and check out these recommended resources.
    Experience with web component development, including JavaScript , JSON coding, and R code.
 
Please post you question related to the digital learning Journey in the Q&A area. 

Our SAP Learning Experts will get back to you as soon as possible! 
We are here to support you.


I appreciate your feedback and we will make sure to continue sharing interesting topics.

Kind regards
